README.md
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 # TF remapper (more efficient and versatile C++ version)
2 
3 [![codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/tradr-project/tf_remapper_cpp/branch/master/graph/badge.svg)](https://codecov.io/gh/tradr-project/tf_remapper_cpp)
4 
5 This package is an alternative to official ROS node [tf/tf_remap](https://github.com/ros/geometry/blob/melodic-devel/tf/scripts/tf_remap) with the following advantages:
6 
7 - Works natively with **TF2**
8  - that could probably save a few data conversions
9 - **Performance**: handles tens of TF subscribers with thousands of TF messages/sec with ease
10  - the official node fully utilizes 2 i7 CPU cores if you have 10 subscribers and publish 2000 TF messages per second
11  - this package needs about 0.4 CPU cores for the same
12 - Can also remap **`/tf_static`**
13  - the official package can not do that correctly
14 - Can also **remove frames** (if you pass empty string to `new`)
15  - this can come handy if you e.g. want to recompute your map in bagfiles using a brand new algorithm
16 - Can **work in both ways**
17  - not only taking frames published on `/tf_old` and remapping and publishing them to `/tf`, but it can also watch `/tf`, perform a reverse remapping, and publish new TF messages to `/tf_old`
18  - this can come handy if you e.g. want to run your robot in a restricted world where it does not know about the other robots (it has its own `/map` frame), and then you have a multirobot coordination algorithm which wants to see the maps of each robot as `/ugv1/map`, `/ugv2/map` and so on, and also wants to publish a `/global_map` frame available to all robots.
19 - Backwards **compatible with [tf/tf_remap](https://github.com/ros/geometry/blob/melodic-devel/tf/scripts/tf_remap)**
20  - to use this remapper, just change package name from `tf` to `tf_remapper_cpp` in your launch files
21  - all the new functionality should not endanger the basic usage, since the package is accompanied by an exhaustive test suite
22 - Documentation and [usage examples](#example-usage-in-launch-files)
23 
24 ## Nodes
25 
26 ### tf\_remapper\_cpp/tf\_remap
27 
28 The node that performs the TF remapping.
29 
30 #### Private parameters
31 
32 - **`mappings`** (`array of dicts`): The rules for TF frame name remapping, e.g. `[{"old": "b", "new": "d"}]`. Each dict presents one remapping rule. Each dict contains keys `old` and `new`. If either of these keys is missing or its value is empty string, it means the TF frame should be deleted.
33  - Until [ros_comm#1498](https://github.com/ros/ros_comm/issues/1498) is fixed, you can not pass this parameter from `rosrun` commandline - either set it in a launch file, or use `rosparam set /tf_remapper/mappings '[{"old": "b", "new": "d"}]'` before launching this node.
34 - **`static_tf`** (`bool`): Whether the remapper acts on static TFs or not. If not set, it is autodetected from `new_tf_topic_name` parameter.
35  - Static TFs need special handling, so be sure to have this parameter set correctly, otherwise it can cause performance issues (when used with non-static TFs) or incorrect operation (if not used with static TFs).
36  - Autodetection checks if the `new_tf_topic_name` is `tf_static` or `/tf_static`, and if it is, then `static_tf` is set to `True`, otherwise it is set to `False`.
37 - **`old_tf_topic_name`** (`string`, default `'/tf_old'`): The topic on which old TFs are subscribed.
38 - **`new_tf_topic_name`** (`string`, default `'/tf'`): The topic on which remapped TFs are published.
39 - **`is_bidirectional`** (`bool`, default `False`): If `True`, the remapper will also allow passing TFs published on the "remapped end" to the "old end" via a reverse mapping.
40  - Pay special attention if you use any kind of multimaster solution or a custom topic transport. This node needs CallerIDs to be unchanged. If this contract is broken, the node will probably enter an infinite loop reacting to its own published messages.
41 
42 #### Subscribed topics
43 
44 - **`/tf_old`** (or any other topic set in `old_tf_topic_name`; type `tf2_ros/TFMessage`): The original TF messages that are to be remapped.
45 - **`/tf`** (or any other topic set in `new_tf_topic_name`; only if `is_bidirectional == True`; type `tf2_ros/TFMessage`): The TF messages with remapped frames. If some node publises to this topic and this remapper is running in bidirectional mode, it sends the newly published transforms back to `/tf_old`.
46 
47 #### Published topics
48 
49 - **`/tf`** (or any other topic set in `new_tf_topic_name`; type `tf2_ros/
50 TFMessage`): The TF messages with remapped frames.
51 - **`/tf_old`** (or any other topic set in `old_tf_topic_name`; only if `is_bidirectional == True`; type `tf2_ros/TFMessage`): The original TF messages. If some node publises to `/tf` and this remapper is running in bidirectional mode, it sends the newly published transforms back to this topic.
52 
53 ## Example usage in launch files
54 
55 ### simple.launch
56 
57  <launch>
58  <group>
59  <remap from="tf" to="tf_old" />
60  <!-- The tf(1) static_transform_publisher does not use /tf_static, but periodically publises to /tf -->
61  <node name="broadcaster_ab" pkg="tf" type="static_transform_publisher" args="1 2 3 4 5 6 a b 10"/>
62  <!-- Usually, there would be e.g. a rosbag play instead of the static tf publisher. -->
63  </group>
64 
65  <node name="remapper" pkg="tf_remapper_cpp" type="tf_remap">
66  <rosparam param="mappings">[{old: b, new: c}]</rosparam>
67  </node>
68 
69  <!-- This node will see transform a->c -->
70  <node name="my_node" pkg="my_pkg" type="node_type" />
71  </launch>
72 
73 ### static_tf.launch
74 
75  <launch>
76  <group>
77  <remap from="tf_static" to="tf_static_old" />
78  <!-- The tf2 static_transform_publisher uses /tf_static -->
79  <node name="broadcaster_ab" pkg="tf2_ros" type="static_transform_publisher" args="1 2 3 4 5 6 a b"/>
80  <!-- Usually, there would be e.g. a rosbag play instead of the static tf publisher. -->
81  </group>
82 
83  <node name="remapper" pkg="tf_remapper_cpp" type="tf_remap">
84  <rosparam param="mappings">[{old: b, new: c}]</rosparam>
85  <!--<param name="static_tf" value="true" /> - this is not needed, autodetection works in this case -->
86  </node>
87 
88  <!-- This node will see static transform a->c -->
89  <node name="my_node" pkg="my_pkg" type="node_type" />
90  </launch>
91 
92 ### bidirectional.launch
93 
94  <launch>
95  <group>
96  <remap from="tf" to="tf_old" />
97  <!-- The tf(1) static_transform_publisher does not use /tf_static, but periodically publises to /tf -->
98  <node name="broadcaster_ab" pkg="tf" type="static_transform_publisher" args="1 2 3 4 5 6 a b 10"/>
99  <!-- Usually, there would be e.g. a rosbag play instead of the static tf publisher. -->
100 
101  <!-- This node will see transforms a->b and d->e -->
102  <node name="my_node2" pkg="my_pkg" type="node_type" />
103  </group>
104 
105  <node name="remapper" pkg="tf_remapper_cpp" type="tf_remap">
106  <rosparam param="mappings">[{old: b, new: c}, {old: e, new: f}]</rosparam>
107  <param name="is_bidirectional" value="true" />
108  </node>
109 
110  <!-- This node will see transforms a->c and d->f -->
111  <node name="my_node" pkg="my_pkg" type="node_type" />
112 
113  <node name="broadcaster_df" pkg="tf" type="static_transform_publisher" args="1 2 3 4 5 6 d f 10"/>
114  </launch>
